verses.text: 神配合的，人不可分開耶穌講完了這些話，就離開加利利，來到約旦河東的猶太境內。
有許多人跟著他；他在那裡醫好了他們。
法利賽人前來試探耶穌，說：「人根據某些理由休妻，可以嗎？」

words.note: A formal term for divorcing a wife, common in older legal/religious texts.

verses.text: 他回答：「造物者從起初『造人的時候，就造男造女』。『因此人要離開父母，與妻子連合，二人成為一體。』這些話你們沒有念過嗎？

words.note: Refers to God as the Creator.
Refers to a deep, permanent union, especially in marriage.

verses.text: 這樣，他們不再是兩個人，而是一體的了。所以 神所配合的，人不可分開。」
他們就問：「為甚麼摩西卻吩咐『人若給了休書，就可以休妻』呢？」

words.note: Lit. 'divorce document'.
Lit. 'divorce wife'.

verses.text: 他說：「摩西因為你們的心硬，才准許你們休妻，但起初並不是這樣。

words.note: Lit. 'divorce wife'.
A common biblical term for 'beginning'.

verses.text: 我告訴你們，凡休妻另娶的，如果不是因為妻子不貞，就是犯姦淫了。」

words.note: Lit. 'divorce wife'.
Biblical term for marital infidelity.
Refers to sexual immorality, especially adultery.

verses.text: 門徒對他說：「夫妻的關係既然是這樣，倒不如不結婚了。」

words.note: Lit. 'door follower/disciple'.

words.definition: might as well not, would be better not to

verses.text: 耶穌對他們說：「這話不是每個人都能領受的，只有賜給誰，誰才能領受。

words.note: Often implies spiritual reception or understanding.
賜 (cì) implies a divine or superior bestowment.
Often implies spiritual reception or understanding.

verses.text: 有些人是生來就不能結婚的，有些人不能結婚是因為人使他們這樣，也有些人是為了天國的緣故自願這樣的。誰能領受就領受吧！」

words.definition: for the sake of, in order to

words.note: Often used in the phrase 為…的緣故 (wèi...de yuángù) 'for the sake of...'
Common in religious contexts, meaning to receive spiritual truths or grace.
Repetition emphasizes willingness and permission.

verses.text: 給小孩子按手祈禱那時，有人帶了小孩子到耶穌面前，求他給他們按手祈禱，門徒就責備那些人。

words.note: A ceremonial act in the Bible for blessing, healing, or consecration.
Refers to students or followers, especially of a religious teacher.

verses.text: 但耶穌說：「讓小孩子到我這裡來，不要禁止他們，因為天國是屬於這樣的人的。」

words.note: Here, it turns the preceding phrase into a noun phrase, 'such people'.

verses.text: 於是他給他們按手，然後離開那裡。
有錢的人難進 神的國有一個人前來見耶穌，說：「老師，我要作甚麼善事，才可以得著永生？」

words.note: The preceding space indicates reverence for God in some Bible translations.
Indicates successful attainment of something.

verses.text: 耶穌說：「為甚麼問我關於善的事呢？只有一位是善的。如果你想進入永生，就應當遵守誡命。」

words.note: Here '善的' means 'the good one'.

verses.text: 他問：「甚麼誡命？」耶穌回答：「就是『不可殺人，不可姦淫，不可偷盜，不可作假證供；

words.note: A verb-object compound from the Ten Commandments.
A classical compound, often functioning as a V-O.
A classical compound, commonly used in biblical context.
Combined with 作假 (zuòjiǎ) means 'bear false witness'.

verses.text: 當孝敬父母，當愛人如己』。」
那青年對他說：「這一切我都遵守了，還缺少甚麼呢？」
耶穌對他說：「如果你想要完全，就去變賣你所有的，分給窮人，你就必定有財寶在天上，而且你要來跟從我。」

words.note: Combined with 的 (de) to form a noun phrase 'all that you have'.
Commonly used in biblical texts for 'heaven'.
In this context, it implies following as a disciple.

verses.text: 那青年聽見這話，就憂憂愁愁地走了，原來他的財產很多。

words.note: A resultative verb compound, 'listen and perceive'.
A reduplicated adjective acting as an adverb, emphasizing the sorrow.
Connects an adjective/adverb to a verb.

verses.text: 耶穌對門徒說：「我實在告訴你們，有錢的人是很難進天國的。

words.note: Lit. 'door follower' or 'gate pupil'.
Lit. 'have money'.
Turns '有錢' into 'the wealthy ones'.
Lit. 'heavenly kingdom'.
Often used at the end of a declarative sentence to emphasize a fact.

verses.text: 我又告訴你們，駱駝穿過針眼，比有錢的人進 神的國還容易呢！」

words.note: Lit. 'have money'.
Turns '有錢' into 'the wealthy ones'.
Often capitalized in Christian texts to denote God.
Adds emphasis or a sense of surprise.

verses.text: 門徒聽見了，十分驚奇，就問他：「這樣，誰可以得救呢？」

words.note: Lit. 'door follower' or 'gate pupil'.
A resultative verb compound, 'listen and perceive'.
Lit. 'ten parts', meaning 'completely'.
Lit. 'obtain salvation'.
Used at the end of a question or to soften a statement.

verses.text: 耶穌看著他們說：「在人這是不能的，在 神卻凡事都能。」

words.note: Emphasizes the definite nature of the statement.
Often capitalized in Christian texts to denote God.

verses.text: 那時彼得對他說：「你看，我們已經捨棄一切跟從了你，我們會得到甚麼呢？」

words.note: More formal/solemn than '放棄' (fàngqì).

verses.text: 耶穌對他們說：「我實在告訴你們，到了萬物更新，人子坐在他榮耀的寶座上的時候，你們這些跟從我的人，也會坐在十二個寶座上，審判以色列的十二個支派。

words.note: Often used in a formal or cosmic sense.
In this context, refers to cosmic or spiritual renewal.
Forms a noun phrase 'those who follow me'.
Can be common in legal context, but here refers to divine judgment.

verses.text: 凡為我的名撇下房屋、兄弟、姊妹、父母、兒女或田地的，他必得著百倍，並且承受永生。

words.note: More literary or formal than '任何人' (rènhérén).
'為我的名' (for my name/sake) is a common biblical phrase.
Stronger than '放棄' (fàngqì), implying abandonment.
Forms a noun phrase 'whoever [does this]'.
More formal/spiritual than '得到' (dédaò), implying full possession.

verses.text: 然而許多在前的將要在後，在後的將要在前。」

words.note: Forms a noun phrase 'those who are first'.
Forms a noun phrase 'those who are last'.
